args:
When the gateway to the otherworld is created,
Phares is able to regain his own will. But when
he attempts to persuade Beren to stop the return,
his brother refuses, and the Progenitor is
unleashed upon the world at long last!
Ah, you've destroyed one of my terminals.\nI would call your work splendid, but this\ndefeat is not anywhere close to the end.
More indeed! They are not done playing\nwith you—not by a long stretch.
I am prepared, Brother. I have seized all\nof the miasma that proliferated throughout\nthis city.
Good. Then all that remains is to pour it\ninto this body and become the gateway.
You are unwilling or unable to forgive us,\nand we cannot fault you for that.
But what you're doing here will kill\nPhares too!
Think not on these things, Beren.\nThis body is but a puppet, remember?

There is but one who can save you—
one who can understand you, who is the
SAME as you. Now bring about their
return by your own hand.
I feel the gateway beginning to form...\nMy return is nigh!
At last! The gateway to the eternal prison\nin which my flesh awaits is complete!
Does this mean the Progenitor\nis actually coming back?
Okay, what the hey is going on?!
I have...waited...for this moment...\nthe moment where my body would\nbecome a gateway to the otherworld.
The moment where your consciousness is\nmore focused on your own body than mine!
It has been some time, my brother.
Have you reclaimed your consciousness\nfrom the Progenitor?!
Unfortunately, no. I fear I can do no more\nthan cut in like this for a short moment.
Which is why you must destroy my body and\nthe gateway while there is still time!
Right now, I serve as a gateway for the\nProgenitor's return. If I am destroyed,\nso too is that link.
We don't have the luxury for questions!\nI cannot keep this up for long!
If you wish to stop the Progenitor's return,\nthis is your only chance!
I understand.\nValyx, {player_name}?\nWe must do this thing.
If it must be done—and it must—\nthen let it be done by our hands.
Is this really the only way...?
Do what ya gotta do, boss! We'll hold off\nthese damn cube dealies!
We shall clear your path, Your Highness!
I can't believe this is how you finally\nregained yourself, Phares...but I won't\ndisappoint you now.
We cannot waste our brother's willingness\nto sacrifice himself for the greater good!
You foolish puppet. You thought to \ninterfere with my will? Prevent my return?
Why do you hesitate, Beren? Go forth and\neliminate all who would stand in the way\nof my return.
Beren, you must realize now what Phares\nwas determined to do!
And there can be only one answer\nto such determination!
Obey me, Beren. THAT is your...\n—No. Stop.
S-stop, Beren... This...is the time...\nfor you to also be free of the Progenitor!
Free? I don't UNDERSTAND!\nWhat am I supposed to do?!
I understand what you want.\nWhat you seek.
Yes. Connection to people.\nBonds with others.
It's true that the Progenitor may be\nthe same as you...
But the Progenitor seeks not bonds\nwith others—not even with you.
Wake up, Beren. Even if you obey the\nProgenitor, you will never have the\nconnection you so desperately crave.
Come with us, Beren. I know we can\ngive you what you seek.
Except we won't GIVE it to you—\nwe'll create that bond together,\nthen grow and nurture it!
You're making it sound more involved than\nit is. A bond isn't something you expressly\nplan a project to create.
Rather, it's something that you look up\none day and realize is there—just as it is\nalready there between us, Beren.
One might call it the bond\nbetween siblings.
Thank you, Phares. And the rest of you.\nI know now what my answer is.
Thank you, my dear, dear siblings.\nThat was really refreshing.
You were mistaken, Phares. Yes, it's true,\nI may have been fixated on a connection...
But that didn't mean I WANTED one.
Because when you told me I already had\nconnections—when you offered to give\nthem to me—I felt no joy at all.
I realized then and there, what I want is\nnot to have bonds, but to destroy them!\nTo eliminate all connections everywhere!
I wanted to teach people who value such\nthings how pointless they truly are!
Th-they're...not pointless... They are the\nvery things that shape the world itself!
Oh? Then use those bonds and\nconnections to stop me!
Since you will not stop trying to interfere,\nI will simply form the gateway in a\ndifferent place.
Ah, but I must! I will transform my own\nbody into the gateway and call forth the\nProgenitor into this world!
